    61	        dataset (pd.DataFrame): the dataset dataframe
    62	        vertical (bool): whether to classify vertically (by token)
    63	        position (str): the token on which to perform classification (subject_q, object, or rel_q)
    64	        include_mlps (bool): whether to include MLPs or not
    65	        include_mlps_l1 (bool): whether to include the first layer of the MLPs or not
    66	        include_mhsa (bool): whether to include the MHSAs or not
    67	        label_encoder (dict): the main label encoder to convert the str labels to ids
    68	
    69	    Returns:
    70	        tuple: a tuple containing the train features, test features, train labels, test labels respectively.
    71	    """
    72	
    73	    activations = combine_selected_modules_activations(
    74	        dataset=dataset,
    75	        vertical=vertical,
    76	        position=position,
    77	        include_mhsa=include_mhsa,
    78	        include_mlps=include_mlps,
    79	        include_mlps_l1=include_mlps_l1,
    80	    )
    81	    targets = np.array([label_encoder[knowledge_source] for knowledge_source in dataset.knowledge_source])
    82	
    83	    return activations, targets
    84	
    85	
    86	def undersample_dataset(dataset: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    87	    """this function undersamples the given dataset containing CK and PK classes
    88	
    89	    Args:
    90	        dataset (pd.DataFrame): the input dataset to undersample to get balanced classes
    91	        prompting_results (pd.DataFrame): the whole dataset
    92	
    93	    Returns:
    94	        pd.DataFrame: the balanced dataset
    95	    """
    96	
    97	    dataset_minority_class_count = min(
    98	        dataset[dataset.knowledge_source == "CK"].shape[0], dataset[dataset.knowledge_source == "PK"].shape[0]
    99	    )
   100	
   101	    dataset_context_knowledge_labels_only = dataset[dataset.knowledge_source == "CK"].sample(
   102	        n=dataset_minority_class_count, random_state=0
   103	    )
   104	
   105	    dataset_parametric_knowledge_labels_only = dataset[dataset.knowledge_source == "PK"].sample(
   106	        n=dataset_minority_class_count, random_state=0
   107	    )
   108	
   109	    balanced_dataset = pd.concat([dataset_context_knowledge_labels_only, dataset_parametric_knowledge_labels_only])
   110	
   111	    return balanced_dataset
